Enhancing business automation with integration
300-level live demo

 ); ![banner](./images/banner-prep.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation and the IBM Cloud Pak for Integration can be combined to streamline a customer account opening process. To illustrate this combination, application integration is added to an existing workflow implementation. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA); Cloud Pak for Integration (CP4I) | | **Demo capabilities** | Workflow (Cloud Pak for Business Automation); Application integration (Cloud Pak for Integration) | | **Demo intro slides** | Download the Introduction and Overview slides here. This is a short deck of customer-facing slides that sets the context for the demo. | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here.

This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | ** Sales enablement video** | View the enablement video here. This video is for enablement purposes only (IBMers and Business Partners) and is not customer-ready. | | **How to get support** | • Open a support case at IBM Technology Zone Help regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **INSTALL THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Integration**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Integration environment
To provision your Cloud Pak for Integration environment, follow these steps:

1. To reserve a preinstalled Cloud Pak for Integration (CP4I) cluster on Red Hat OpenShift, go here. Select if you prefer to make a reservation now or schedule for later.

2. If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** (1) for a 3-day reservation (which can be extended to 8 days) and fill in the **Purpose description** (2).

3. Select the **Preferred Geography**.

4. Several additional fields will appear, the defaults can remain. Scroll down and click **Submit**.

5. You will receive several emails as the provisioning process continues. You should expect the final email to be sent after 2-3 hours. The final email should look similar to the following.

**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Access your OpenShift cluster and install the command line
In this section, you access your OpenShift cluster and install the OpenShift command line tool.
1. From the final email open the **PakInstaller Portal** link.

2. Navigate to the **OpenShift Console** tab.

3. Scroll down and open the **OpenShift Web Console** link (1) using kubeadmin as the username and **password** (2) shown.

4. On the web console page, click **?** (1), and select **Command line tools** (2).

5. Follow the links to install the OpenShift Command Line Interface (CLI) for your Operating System.

6. To configure the command line on your machine copy and run the **OC Login command**.


You have successfully configured the Openshift command line on your machine.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Clone the demo assets from a GitHub repository and deploy
To copy the repository you will need to have the Git CLI on your machine. If you don’t have it, follow the installation steps described in this page, based on your operating system.
1. To download the scripts to run the demo, create a directory, and from there run the following command:
``` git clone https://github.com/IBM/platinum-demo-code-cp4icp4ba.git ```
2. Change to the new cloud-native-integration directory:
``` cd platinum-demo-code-cp4icp4ba/cp4i/ ```
3. The script to install the demo components requires a utility called jq. If you don't have it, follow the installation steps described in this page, based on your operating system.
4. Install API Connect, App Connect and MQ by running the `deploy.sh` command:
``` ./deploy.sh ```
**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Prerequisites and preparing your Cloud Pak for Integration environment
**Connect Cloud Pak for Integration to your endpoints**

Now, let's configure our services endpoints in Cloud Pak for Integration.

1. Return the connectivity instructions from section 2.2, navigate to the **Cloud Pak Console** (1) tab and use the credentials (2) access the Platform Navigator.




If you are using Chrome, you may see a certificate error when accessing the page. To bypass this, type thisisunsafe and press return.
2. In the menu on the top left, open the **Design** folder (1) and select **Integrations** (2).


3. Click on the **ace-designer-demo** entry.


4. Click the **Catalog** icon to see a list of the available connectors.


5. To configure the MQ connection, search for **'IBM MQ'** (1) and click **Connect** (2).


6. Enter **'basicmq'** for the **Queue manager name** (1), **'basicmq-ibm-mq'** for the **Queue manager hostname** (2), and **'1414'** for the **Listener port number** (3).


7. Enter **'SYSTEM.DEF.SVRCONN'** for the **Channel name** (1), and click **Connect** (2).


8. Click **Continue**.


9. Scroll to the top of the page, and click the **+** button to the right of the search bar.


10. Access the API definition for the external account service here. Download the file using **File** --> **Save Page as**.

11. Select **OpenAPI** (1) for the Document type, the downloaded **CustomerAccountOpenAPIJSONServer.yaml** file (2), and click **Next** (3).


12. Click **Import API**.


13. Search for **Customer Account** (1), and click **Connect** (2).


14. Scroll down and click **Connect**.

**Import flows to App Connect Designer**

1. Download the following two files:
• MQ flow to simulate the acquired bank
• Accounts API flow that workflow will use

2. Import the **MQExternalProvider.yaml** file by clicking the **Dashboard** icon (1), then **New** (2), and then **Import flow…** (3).


3. Select the downloaded **MQExternalProvider.yaml** file (1), and click **Import** (2).


4. Start the imported flow by selecting **Start flow** (1).


5. Repeat steps 2 - 4 for the **Accounts.yaml** file. This time, the flow is started by switching the toggle from **Stopped** to **Started**.


**Test the flow**

1. Select the **Test** tab (1), **Get /Accounts/{customerId}** operation (2), and then the **Try it** tab (3).


2. Scroll down and enter '**1234567890**' in the **customerId** field (1), and click **Send** (2).


3. The first test will fail due to a known timeout issue with the error shown in the screenshot below. Click **Send** a second time to receive the correct response.


4. You will see the following correct response.


5. Three environmentally specific pieces of information are required to integrate the API into the workflow: the API URL, client ID and hostname.

Scroll to the top of the screen and save the **API URL** (1) and **client ID** (2).

The hostname is contained within the API URL. It is the portion between "http://" and the next "/".

The hostname will look like this: ademo-gw-gateway-cp4i.itzroks-120000k3ak-vzlud5-4b4a324f027aea19c5cbc0c3275c4656-0000.eu-de.containers.appdomain.cloud

Save the hostname with the API URL and client ID.


**[Go to top](#top)**
## **INSTALL THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Business Automation (Windows VM)**
1 - Provision a Technology Zone demo environment
1. Reserve a Technology Zone demo environment here.
2. Wait until your reservation status is **Ready** on the IBM Technology Zone’s **My Library → My Reservations** page. (You can either keep refreshing the My Reservation page or wait for a confirmation email.)

When your reservation is **Ready**, click the reservation tile to view the reservation details.


3. On the reservation details page, copy or bookmark the **Published services** links for **BAW Workflow Center** and **BAW Process Portal**.

When your reservation is **Ready**, click the reservation tile to view the reservation details.


**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Import the signer certificate for Cloud Pak for Integration
1. From the reservation details page, scroll down and click to open the BAW Remote Console. It is the link on the left.


2. The console will open. Click **Full screen.**


3. Click **Yes** on the **Networks** dialog box.
The first time you access the VM, you will be presented with the network option below. It is imperative to select YES. (Otherwise, the VM will not be properly configured for this demo.)

4. On the Windows desktop, double-click the **WebSphere Console** shortcut to open the WebSphere Console.


5. Click **Advanced…**, then **Accept the Risk and Continue** to continue past the security warning.

6. Enter '**admin**' as the **User ID** and '**admin**' as the **Password**.


7. Open **Security** (1) and click **SSL certificate and key management** (2).


8. Click **Key stores and certificates**.


9. Click **CellDefaultTrustStore**.


10. Click **Signer certificates**.


11. Click **Retrieve from port**.


12. For **Host**, enter your Cloud Pak for Integration ROKS hostname. For **Port**, enter '**443**'. For **Alias**, enter '**integration-1**'. Click **Retrieve signer information**.


13. Click **Apply**.


14. Click **Save**.


15. The new certificate is now added.


You can now close the BAW VM console window.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Import the process app and update the 'AccountsServer' hostname in the process app settings
Before completing this section, download the Select the **New Account Opening.twx** file.

1. Using a browser on your local computer, open **BAW Workflow Center** using the Published Services link from the top of the Technology Zone reservation page.

2. Log in to **Workflow Center** using '**admin**' as both the **User name** and **Password**.


3. Click **Process Apps**.


4. Click **Import**.


5. Click **Browse**.


6. Select the **New_Account_Opening.twx** file (1). Click **Open** (2).


7. Click **OK**.


8. Wait for the import to complete. Click **New Account Opening**.


9. Click the **Servers** tab.


10. In **Process App Settings**, **AccountsServer** must be updated with the hostname of your Cloud Pak for Integration ROKS environment. Set **Hostname** to the hostname of your Cloud Pak for Integration ROKS environment.


**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO**
1 - Log into Cloud Pak for Integration
1. Open **Cloud Pak for Integration** and click **IBM provided credentials (admin only)**.


2. Enter your admin username and password (1), and click **Log in** (2).


3. Click **Integration instances**.


4. On the **Integration instances** page, click **ace-designer-demo**.


**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Open the account opening process in Process Designer
1. Using Firefox on your local computer, open **BAW Workflow Center** using the Published Services link from the top of the Technology Zone reservation page. Using separate browsers for Process Designer vs. Process Portal prevents the logins from colliding with each other.
2. Log in to **Workflow Center** using '**admin**' as both the **User name** and **Password**.


3. Click **Process Apps**.


4. Click **New Account Opening**.


5. Click **Processes** (1) and then **New Account (Current Workflow)** (2).


6. The **New Account (Current Workflow)** process definition is now open.


**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Log into Process Portal
1. Using Chrome on your local computer, open **BAW Process Portal** using the Published Services link from the top of the Technology Zone reservation page. Using separate browsers for Process Designer vs. Process Portal prevents the logins from colliding with each other.
2. Log in with **'assistant'** as the **Username** and **'passw0rd'** as the **Password**.


3. **Process Portal** is now open.


**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Have the API key handy
The very last step of the Cloud Pak for Integration installation (above) required you to save the API key (**client ID**).
In the demo script, you will be required to enter the Cloud Pak for Integration API key into the process application. Make sure the API key is easily accessible.
For easy access, store the API key in the Windows clipboard.
**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Have the YAML file handy
In the demo script, you will be required to use the OpenAPI 3.0 YAML file to discover the API. Download the YAML file **here**.
**[Go to top](#top)**
*** Click [here](/300-enhancing-ba-with-integration/demo-script) to go to the **Demo script** on the next tab.
